title: pkgdepR
text: ever wanted visualize dependencies functions group R packages developed? pkgdepR takes number (correctly compiled) R packages finds links function namespaces.

title: pkgdepR
text: pkgdepR created solve particular problem developing interrelated R packages wanting see functions package interacted. particularly useful managing function dependencies across large code base R packages.

title: pkgdepR
text: pkgdepR simply takes argument vector package names (already search path) explores functions namespaces interact. two stages: Getting intra-package function dependencies package; Getting inter-package function dependencies combination packages. defined name particular package’s namespace also function decomposed. decomposition, function found called within contents, link created. properly identify distinct name calls, search done package tag preceding name (.e. ::). tag exists, search imported function conducted. hand, function name already declared primary namespace, obviously function called. function ambiguously called (without package tag explicitly imported another namespace) deliberately ignored linkage. linkage environment-dependent change depending contents search path particular session.

title: pkgdepR
text: main wrapper function pkgdepR pkgdepR::deps(...) returns object class pkgdepR. S3 method created objects class pkgdepR can easily plotted. See ?pkgdepR::plot.pkgdepR details. pkgdepR makes use fantastic visNetwork package creating interactive network visualization functions present R packages. implemented methods class :
code: methods(class = "pkgdepR") #> [1] plot    print   summary #> see '?methods' for accessing help and source code

title: pkgdepR
text: links functions determined statically, meaning dependencies identified without executing code. , functions defined dynamically run-time picked . example , foo() picked declared package’s namespace. However, bar() picked defined run-time foo() called. Similarly, can cases linkages created may occur run-time. Let’s add previous example, adding function bar() declared package namespace interested . , statically, appears foo() calling bar() namespace interested . However, run-time, know case, bar() clearly defined locally local function called. instance, pkgdepR show link package::foo() package::bar() real run-time dependency exists. cases rarely arise normal package development, important aware behaviour nonetheless.
code: # @title foo function # @export foo = function() { # - this will be picked up!    bar = function() { # - this won't be picked up!      }      bar()  } # @title bar function # @export bar = function() { # - this will be picked up!  }

title: pkgdepR
text: can install released version pkgdepR CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: pkgdepR
text: ’ll show example use pkgdepR. First, let’s load required packages. required packages now added search path.

title: pkgdepR
text: Create pkgdepR object follows: can see summary object see network visualization, simply call plot.
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = "pkgdepR") v #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    pkgdepR #> Total nodes: 16 #> Total links: 17 #>   -Between packages: 0 #>   -Within packages:  17 #>     --Between functions: 16 #>     --Self-referential:  1 plot(v, height = "500px", main = list(text = NULL))

title: pkgdepR
text: Visualizing multiple packages works similar way. ’s simple ! Back top
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = c("pkgdepR", "magrittr")) v #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    pkgdepR, magrittr #> Total nodes: 64 #> Total links: 30 #>   -Between packages: 6 #>   -Within packages:  24 #>     --Between functions: 23 #>     --Self-referential:  1 plot(v, height = "700px", main = list(text = NULL), option = "E")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ed Peyton. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Peyton E (2022). “pkgdepR: package tracking visualizing package function dependencies.” https://pkgdepr.org/.
code: @Misc{,   title = {pkgdepR: A package for tracking and visualizing package function dependencies},   author = {Ed Peyton},   year = {2022},   url = {https://pkgdepr.org/}, }

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: ever wanted visualize dependencies functions group R packages developed? pkgdepR takes number (correctly compiled) R packages finds links function namespaces.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: pkgdepR created solve particular problem developing interrelated R packages wanting see functions package interacted. particularly useful managing function dependencies across large code base R packages.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: pkgdepR simply takes argument vector package names (already search path) explores functions namespaces interact. two stages: Getting intra-package function dependencies package; Getting inter-package function dependencies combination packages. defined name particular package’s namespace also function decomposed. decomposition, function found called within contents, link created. properly identify distinct name calls, search done package tag preceding name (.e. ::). tag exists, search imported function conducted. hand, function name already declared primary namespace, obviously function called. function ambiguously called (without package tag explicitly imported another namespace) deliberately ignored linkage. linkage environment-dependent change depending contents search path particular session.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: main wrapper function pkgdepR pkgdepR::deps(...) returns object class pkgdepR. S3 method created objects class pkgdepR can easily plotted. See ?pkgdepR::plot.pkgdepR details. pkgdepR makes use fantastic visNetwork package creating interactive network visualization functions present R packages. implemented methods class :
code: methods(class = "pkgdepR") #> [1] plot    print   summary #> see '?methods' for accessing help and source code

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: links functions determined statically, meaning dependencies identified without executing code. , functions defined dynamically run-time picked . example , foo() picked declared package’s namespace. However, bar() picked defined run-time foo() called. Similarly, can cases linkages created may occur run-time. Let’s add previous example, adding function bar() declared package namespace interested . , statically, appears foo() calling bar() namespace interested . However, run-time, know case, bar() clearly defined locally local function called. instance, pkgdepR show link package::foo() package::bar() real run-time dependency exists. cases rarely arise normal package development, important aware behaviour nonetheless.
code: # @title foo function # @export foo = function() { # - this will be picked up!    bar = function() { # - this won't be picked up!      }      bar()  } # @title bar function # @export bar = function() { # - this will be picked up!  }

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: ’ll show example use pkgdepR. First, let’s load required packages. required packages now added search path.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: Create pkgdepR object follows: can see summary object see network visualization, simply call plot.
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = "pkgdepR") v #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    pkgdepR #> Total nodes: 16 #> Total links: 17 #>   -Between packages: 0 #>   -Within packages:  17 #>     --Between functions: 16 #>     --Self-referential:  1 plot(dep)

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages
text: Visualizing multiple packages works similar way.
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = c("pkgdepR", "magrittr")) v # alternatively, summary(v) or print(v) #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    pkgdepR, magrittr #> Total nodes: 64 #> Total links: 30 #>   -Between packages: 6 #>   -Within packages:  24 #>     --Between functions: 23 #>     --Self-referential:  1 plot(v)

title: Get environment dependency object — deps

title: Get environment dependency object — deps
text: pkg character vector environments explore. search path. base. exported_only Boolean. Whether include non-exported functions.

title: Get environment dependency object — deps
text: object class pkgdepR.

title: Get environment dependency object — deps
text: object class pkgdepR list three named objects: funs data frame describing functions. Contains columns id, label, package, exported, group, name. links data frame containing linkages functions. Contains columns . pkg character vector containing packages explored.

title: Get environment dependency object — deps
code: library(pkgdepR) deps(pkg = "pkgdepR") #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    pkgdepR #> Total nodes: 16 #> Total links: 17 #>   -Between packages: 0 #>   -Within packages:  17 #>     --Between functions: 16 #>     --Self-referential:  1 #>

what: pkgdepR: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages — pkgdepR-package
title: pkgdepR: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages — pkgdepR-package
text: Statically determine visualize function dependencies within across packages. may useful managing function dependencies across code base multiple R packages.

title: pkgdepR: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages — pkgdepR-package
text: function likely need pkgdepR deps, returns object class pkgdepR. object class pkgdepR list three named objects: funs data frame describing functions. Contains columns id, label, package, exported, group, name. links data frame containing linkages functions. Contains columns . pkg character vector containing packages explored.

title: pkgdepR: Statically Determine Function Dependencies Between Packages — pkgdepR-package
text: Maintainer: Ed Peyton edppeyton@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Visualizing package dependencies — plot.pkgdepR
text: function simple wrapper plotting network visualization using visNetwork.

title: Visualizing package dependencies — plot.pkgdepR
code: # S3 method for class 'pkgdepR' plot(   x,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   main = NULL,   submain = NULL,   alpha = 0.8,   footer = NULL,   background = "rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)",   n,   m,   ... )

title: Visualizing package dependencies — plot.pkgdepR
text: x object class pkgdepR. width width vis.js render. height height vis.js render. main title. remove title, pass list(text = NULL). submain subtitle. remove subtitle, pass list(text = NULL). alpha transparency value use colors. Must 0 1. footer character named list. See visNetwork. background background color. See visNetwork. n (Optional) number colours request viridis. Allows user set granular palette. m (Optional) subset colours custom palette (specified n) use plot. ... arguments passed onto viridis.

title: Visualizing package dependencies — plot.pkgdepR
text: object classes visNetwork htmlwidget.

title: pkgdepR 1.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-19 Bug fix deps

title: pkgdepR 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-18 Fixed bug plot method pkgdepR objects Fixed issue identifying links non-exported functions. Fixed bug packages <2 functions defined.

title: pkgdepR 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-16 Initial commit submission CRAN. deps(...) main wrapper function creating network links. plot(<pkgdepR>) main method visualizing object class pkgdepR.
